00049 enum md_echo_cmd {
00050         ECHO_MD_CREATE          = 1, /* Open/Create file on MDT */
00051         ECHO_MD_MKDIR           = 2, /* Mkdir on MDT */
00052         ECHO_MD_DESTROY         = 3, /* Unlink file on MDT */
00053         ECHO_MD_RMDIR           = 4, /* Rmdir on MDT */
00054         ECHO_MD_LOOKUP          = 5, /* Lookup on MDT */
00055         ECHO_MD_GETATTR         = 6, /* Getattr on MDT */
00056         ECHO_MD_SETATTR         = 7, /* Setattr on MDT */
00057         ECHO_MD_ALLOC_FID       = 8, /* Get FIDs from MDT */
00058 };

00060 #define OBD_DEV_ID 1
00061 #define OBD_DEV_NAME "obd"
00062 #define OBD_DEV_PATH "/dev/" OBD_DEV_NAME
00063 #define OBD_DEV_MAJOR 10
00064 #define OBD_DEV_MINOR 241
00065 
00066 #define OBD_IOCTL_VERSION       0x00010004
00067 #define OBD_DEV_BY_DEVNAME      0xffffd0de
00068 #define OBD_MAX_IOCTL_BUFFER    CONFIG_LUSTRE_OBD_MAX_IOCTL_BUFFER
00069 
00070 struct obd_ioctl_data {
00071         __u32           ioc_len;
00072         __u32           ioc_version;
00073 
00074         union {
00075                 __u64   ioc_cookie;
00076                 __u64   ioc_u64_1;
00077         };
00078         union {
00079                 __u32   ioc_conn1;
00080                 __u32   ioc_u32_1;
00081         };
00082         union {
00083                 __u32   ioc_conn2;
00084                 __u32   ioc_u32_2;
00085         };
00086 
00087         struct obdo     ioc_obdo1;
00088         struct obdo     ioc_obdo2;
00089 
00090         __u64           ioc_count;
00091         __u64           ioc_offset;
00092         __u32           ioc_dev;
00093         __u32           ioc_command;
00094 
00095         __u64           ioc_nid;
00096         __u32           ioc_nal;
00097         __u32           ioc_type;
00098 
00099         /* buffers the kernel will treat as user pointers */
00100         __u32           ioc_plen1;
00101         char __user    *ioc_pbuf1;
00102         __u32           ioc_plen2;
00103         char __user    *ioc_pbuf2;
00104 
00105         /* inline buffers for various arguments */
00106         __u32           ioc_inllen1;
00107         char           *ioc_inlbuf1;
00108         __u32           ioc_inllen2;
00109         char           *ioc_inlbuf2;
00110         __u32           ioc_inllen3;
00111         char           *ioc_inlbuf3;
00112         __u32           ioc_inllen4;
00113         char           *ioc_inlbuf4;
00114 
00115         char            ioc_bulk[0];
00116 };
00117 
00118 struct obd_ioctl_hdr {
00119         __u32           ioc_len;
00120         __u32           ioc_version;
00121 };
00122 
00123 static inline __u32 obd_ioctl_packlen(struct obd_ioctl_data *data)
00124 {
00125         __u32 len = cfs_size_round(sizeof(*data));
00126 
00127         len += cfs_size_round(data->ioc_inllen1);
00128         len += cfs_size_round(data->ioc_inllen2);
00129         len += cfs_size_round(data->ioc_inllen3);
00130         len += cfs_size_round(data->ioc_inllen4);
00131 
00132         return len;
00133 }
00134 
00135 static inline int obd_ioctl_is_invalid(struct obd_ioctl_data *data)
00136 {
00137         if (data->ioc_len > (1 << 30)) {
00138                 CERROR("OBD ioctl: ioc_len larger than 1<<30\n");
00139                 return 1;
00140         }
00141 
00142         if (data->ioc_inllen1 > (1 << 30)) {
00143                 CERROR("OBD ioctl: ioc_inllen1 larger than 1<<30\n");
00144                 return 1;
00145         }
00146 
00147         if (data->ioc_inllen2 > (1 << 30)) {
00148                 CERROR("OBD ioctl: ioc_inllen2 larger than 1<<30\n");
00149                 return 1;
00150         }
00151 
00152         if (data->ioc_inllen3 > (1 << 30)) {
00153                 CERROR("OBD ioctl: ioc_inllen3 larger than 1<<30\n");
00154                 return 1;
00155         }
00156 
00157         if (data->ioc_inllen4 > (1 << 30)) {
00158                 CERROR("OBD ioctl: ioc_inllen4 larger than 1<<30\n");
00159                 return 1;
00160         }
00161 
00162         if (data->ioc_inlbuf1 != NULL && data->ioc_inllen1 == 0) {
00163                 CERROR("OBD ioctl: inlbuf1 pointer but 0 length\n");
00164                 return 1;
00165         }
00166 
00167         if (data->ioc_inlbuf2 != NULL && data->ioc_inllen2 == 0) {
00168                 CERROR("OBD ioctl: inlbuf2 pointer but 0 length\n");
00169                 return 1;
00170         }
00171 
00172         if (data->ioc_inlbuf3 != NULL && data->ioc_inllen3 == 0) {
00173                 CERROR("OBD ioctl: inlbuf3 pointer but 0 length\n");
00174                 return 1;
00175         }
00176 
00177         if (data->ioc_inlbuf4 != NULL && data->ioc_inllen4 == 0) {
00178                 CERROR("OBD ioctl: inlbuf4 pointer but 0 length\n");
00179                 return 1;
00180         }
00181 
00182         if (data->ioc_pbuf1 != NULL && data->ioc_plen1 == 0) {
00183                 CERROR("OBD ioctl: pbuf1 pointer but 0 length\n");
00184                 return 1;
00185         }
00186 
00187         if (data->ioc_pbuf2 != NULL && data->ioc_plen2 == 0) {
00188                 CERROR("OBD ioctl: pbuf2 pointer but 0 length\n");
00189                 return 1;
00190         }
00191 
00192         if (data->ioc_pbuf1 == NULL && data->ioc_plen1 != 0) {
00193                 CERROR("OBD ioctl: plen1 set but NULL pointer\n");
00194                 return 1;
00195         }
00196 
00197         if (data->ioc_pbuf2 == NULL && data->ioc_plen2 != 0) {
00198                 CERROR("OBD ioctl: plen2 set but NULL pointer\n");
00199                 return 1;
00200         }
00201 
00202         if (obd_ioctl_packlen(data) > data->ioc_len) {
00203                 CERROR("OBD ioctl: packlen exceeds ioc_len (%d > %d)\n",
00204                        obd_ioctl_packlen(data), data->ioc_len);
00205                 return 1;
00206         }
00207 
00208         return 0;
00209 }
00210 
00211 #ifdef __KERNEL__
00212 
00213 int obd_ioctl_getdata(char **buf, int *len, void __user *arg);
00214 int obd_ioctl_popdata(void __user *arg, void *data, int len);
00215 
00216 static inline void obd_ioctl_freedata(char *buf, size_t len)
00217 {
00218         ENTRY;
00219 
00220         OBD_FREE_LARGE(buf, len);
00221         EXIT;
00222 }
00223 
00224 #else /* __KERNEL__ */
00225 
00226 static inline int obd_ioctl_pack(struct obd_ioctl_data *data, char **pbuf,
00227                                  int max_len)
00228 {
00229         char *ptr;
00230         struct obd_ioctl_data *overlay;
00231 
00232         data->ioc_len = obd_ioctl_packlen(data);
00233         data->ioc_version = OBD_IOCTL_VERSION;
00234 
00235         if (*pbuf != NULL && data->ioc_len > max_len) {
00236                 fprintf(stderr, "pbuf = %p, ioc_len = %u, max_len = %d\n",
00237                         *pbuf, data->ioc_len, max_len);
00238                 return -EINVAL;
00239         }
00240 
00241         if (*pbuf == NULL)
00242                 *pbuf = malloc(data->ioc_len);
00243 
00244         if (*pbuf == NULL)
00245                 return -ENOMEM;
00246 
00247         overlay = (struct obd_ioctl_data *)*pbuf;
00248         memcpy(*pbuf, data, sizeof(*data));
00249 
00250         ptr = overlay->ioc_bulk;
00251         if (data->ioc_inlbuf1 != NULL)
00252                 LOGL(data->ioc_inlbuf1, data->ioc_inllen1, ptr);
00253 
00254         if (data->ioc_inlbuf2 != NULL)
00255                 LOGL(data->ioc_inlbuf2, data->ioc_inllen2, ptr);
00256 
00257         if (data->ioc_inlbuf3 != NULL)
00258                 LOGL(data->ioc_inlbuf3, data->ioc_inllen3, ptr);
00259 
00260         if (data->ioc_inlbuf4 != NULL)
00261                 LOGL(data->ioc_inlbuf4, data->ioc_inllen4, ptr);
00262 
00263         if (obd_ioctl_is_invalid(overlay)) {
00264                 fprintf(stderr, "invalid ioctl data: ioc_len = %u, "
00265                         "max_len = %d\n",
00266                         data->ioc_len, max_len);
00267                 return -EINVAL;
00268         }
00269 
00270         return 0;
00271 }
00272 
00273 static inline int
00274 obd_ioctl_unpack(struct obd_ioctl_data *data, char *pbuf, int max_len)
00275 {
00276         char *ptr;
00277         struct obd_ioctl_data *overlay;
00278 
00279         if (pbuf == NULL)
00280                 return 1;
00281 
00282         overlay = (struct obd_ioctl_data *)pbuf;
00283 
00284         /* Preserve the caller's buffer pointers */
00285         overlay->ioc_inlbuf1 = data->ioc_inlbuf1;
00286         overlay->ioc_inlbuf2 = data->ioc_inlbuf2;
00287         overlay->ioc_inlbuf3 = data->ioc_inlbuf3;
00288         overlay->ioc_inlbuf4 = data->ioc_inlbuf4;
00289 
00290         memcpy(data, pbuf, sizeof(*data));
00291 
00292         ptr = overlay->ioc_bulk;
00293         if (data->ioc_inlbuf1 != NULL)
00294                 LOGU(data->ioc_inlbuf1, data->ioc_inllen1, ptr);
00295 
00296         if (data->ioc_inlbuf2 != NULL)
00297                 LOGU(data->ioc_inlbuf2, data->ioc_inllen2, ptr);
00298 
00299         if (data->ioc_inlbuf3 != NULL)
00300                 LOGU(data->ioc_inlbuf3, data->ioc_inllen3, ptr);
00301 
00302         if (data->ioc_inlbuf4 != NULL)
00303                 LOGU(data->ioc_inlbuf4, data->ioc_inllen4, ptr);
00304 
00305         return 0;
00306 }
00307 
00308 #endif /* !__KERNEL__ */
00309 
00310 /* OBD_IOC_DATA_TYPE is only for compatibility reasons with older
00311  * Linux Lustre user tools. New ioctls should NOT use this macro as
00312  * the ioctl "size". Instead the ioctl should get a "size" argument
00313  * which is the actual data type used by the ioctl, to ensure the
00314  * ioctl interface is versioned correctly. */
00315 #define OBD_IOC_DATA_TYPE       long
00316 
00317 /*      IOC_LDLM_TEST           _IOWR('f', 40, long) */
00318 /*      IOC_LDLM_DUMP           _IOWR('f', 41, long) */
00319 /*      IOC_LDLM_REGRESS_START  _IOWR('f', 42, long) */
00320 /*      IOC_LDLM_REGRESS_STOP   _IOWR('f', 43, long) */
00321 
00322 #define OBD_IOC_CREATE          _IOWR('f', 101, OBD_IOC_DATA_TYPE)
00323 #define OBD_IOC_DESTROY         _IOW ('f', 104, OBD_IOC_DATA_TYPE)
00324 /*      OBD_IOC_PREALLOCATE     _IOWR('f', 105, OBD_IOC_DATA_TYPE) */
00325 
00326 #define OBD_IOC_SETATTR         _IOW ('f', 107, OBD_IOC_DATA_TYPE)
00327 #define OBD_IOC_GETATTR         _IOWR('f', 108, OBD_IOC_DATA_TYPE)
00328 #define OBD_IOC_READ            _IOWR('f', 109, OBD_IOC_DATA_TYPE)
00329 #define OBD_IOC_WRITE           _IOWR('f', 110, OBD_IOC_DATA_TYPE)
00330 
00331 #define OBD_IOC_STATFS          _IOWR('f', 113, OBD_IOC_DATA_TYPE)
00332 #define OBD_IOC_SYNC            _IOW ('f', 114, OBD_IOC_DATA_TYPE)
00333 /*      OBD_IOC_READ2           _IOWR('f', 115, OBD_IOC_DATA_TYPE) */
00334 /*      OBD_IOC_FORMAT          _IOWR('f', 116, OBD_IOC_DATA_TYPE) */
00335 /*      OBD_IOC_PARTITION       _IOWR('f', 117, OBD_IOC_DATA_TYPE) */
00336 /*      OBD_IOC_COPY            _IOWR('f', 120, OBD_IOC_DATA_TYPE) */
00337 /*      OBD_IOC_MIGR            _IOWR('f', 121, OBD_IOC_DATA_TYPE) */
00338 /*      OBD_IOC_PUNCH           _IOWR('f', 122, OBD_IOC_DATA_TYPE) */
00339 
00340 /*      OBD_IOC_MODULE_DEBUG    _IOWR('f', 124, OBD_IOC_DATA_TYPE) */
00341 #define OBD_IOC_BRW_READ        _IOWR('f', 125, OBD_IOC_DATA_TYPE)

00350 #define OBD_IOC_PING_TARGET     _IOW ('f', 136, OBD_IOC_DATA_TYPE)
